entry.title: Putin's Unexpected Challenge: Snubs From His Central Asian Allies
entry.content: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has Kazakhstan and its neighbors rethinking their alliances. That’s given the U.S. a window to try to regain influence in a region it had stepped back from in recent years.

entry.title: Russian Strikes Take Toll on Civilians as Ukraine Gears Up for Counteroffensive
entry.content: Exactly five months into the war, artillery and missile attacks have become a daily part of life in much of Ukraine.

entry.title: Ukraine Struggles to Identify Russians Suspected of War Crimes
entry.content: Ukraine has opened investigations into more than 16,000 suspected war crimes, but despite evidence has indicted only a small number of Russians.
